canonicalsolution

Class PRQuadtree

  • java.lang.Object
    • canonicalsolution.PRQuadtree

  • public class PRQuadtree
extends java.lang.Object
    PR Quadtree is a region quadtree capable of storing points.
    Version:
    2.0, 23 Jan 2007
    Author:
    Ben Zoller

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PRQuadtree.CityAlreadyMappedException
      Thrown if city is already in the spatial map upon attempted insertion.
      class  PRQuadtree.CityOutOfBoundsException
      Thrown if a city attempted to be mapped is outside the bounds of the spatial map.
      class  PRQuadtree.EmptyNode
      Represents an empty leaf node of a PR Quadtree.
      class  PRQuadtree.InternalNode
      Represents an internal node of a PR Quadtree.
      class  PRQuadtree.LeafNode
      Represents a leaf node of a PR Quadtree.
      class  PRQuadtree.Node
      Node abstract class for a PR Quadtree.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PRQuadtree()
      Constructs an empty PR Quadtree.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(City city)
      Inserts a city into the spatial map.

      Clears the PR Quadtree so it contains no non-empty nodes.

      Returns if the PR Quadtree contains a city with the given name.

      Gets the root node of the PR Quadtree.

      Gets the height of the spatial map

      Gets the width of the spatial map
      boolean intersects(cmsc420.geom.Circle2D circle, java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D rect)
      Returns if any part of a circle lies within a given rectangular bounds according to the rules of the PR Quadtree.

      Whether the PR Quadtree has zero or more elements.

      Removes a given city from the spatial map.

        spatialHeight - height of the spatial map

        Sets the graphical representation of the spatial map.
        Parameters:

        public PRQuadtree.Node getRoot()
        Gets the root node of the PR Quadtree.
        Returns:
        root node of the PR Quadtree

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Whether the PR Quadtree has zero or more elements.
        Returns:
        true if the PR Quadtree has no non-empty nodes. Otherwise returns false

      • add

        public void add(City city)
         throws PRQuadtree.CityAlreadyMappedException,
                PRQuadtree.CityOutOfBoundsException
        Inserts a city into the spatial map.
        Parameters:
        city - city to be added
        Throws:
        PRQuadtree.CityAlreadyMappedException - city is already in the spatial map
        PRQuadtree.CityOutOfBoundsException - city's location is outside the bounds of the spatial map

      • remove

        public boolean remove(City city)
        Removes a given city from the spatial map.
        Parameters:
        city - city to be removed
        Throws:
        CityNotMappedException - city is not in the spatial map

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the PR Quadtree so it contains no non-empty nodes.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String name)
        Returns if the PR Quadtree contains a city with the given name.
        Returns:
        true if the city is in the spatial map. false otherwise.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(cmsc420.geom.Circle2D circle,
                 java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D rect)
        Returns if any part of a circle lies within a given rectangular bounds according to the rules of the PR Quadtree.
        Parameters:
        circle - circular region to be checked
        rect - rectangular bounds the point is being checked against
        Returns:
        true if the point lies within the rectangular bounds, false otherwise
